WHG

Class LevelFive

  • java.lang.Object
    • WHG.LevelFive

  • public class LevelFive
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to draw level five on the screen to be played.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LevelFive(Square s, Coin c)
      Initialization constructor to initialize the array lists, square, coin, and speeds.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBall(Ball b1)
      This method adds a ball to the array list of balls.
      void addBall(Ball b1, Ball b2, Ball b3, Ball b4, Ball b5, Ball b6, Ball b7, Ball b8, Ball b9, Ball b10)
      This method adds multiple balls in the array list in one call.

      This method adds multiple walls in the array list in one call.
      void checkCollide()
      This method goes through each array list of objects and checks collisions between all of them.
      void drawAll(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
      This method draws all of the objects on the screen.

      This method gets the array list of balls.
      boolean getCollide()
      This method gets the collision state between the square and the balls.
      void resetAllBalls()
      This method resets the balls to their original positions and speeds once the square is also reset.
      void setCollide(boolean c)
      This method sets whether the collision should be on with the balls and the square or not.
      void updateAll(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
      This method updates the objects that need to be updated on the screen.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelFive

        public LevelFive(Square s,
                 Coin c)
        Initialization constructor to initialize the array lists, square, coin, and speeds. It initializes all the walls and balls to be placed in the level as well.
        Parameters:
        s - is the square.
        c - is the one coin in this level.

        public void setCollide(boolean c)
